bibl.title: Letter from Wade Hampton Frost to Frederick F. Russell, December 27, 1923

div1.p: Frost asks Russell for a copy of Carter's work on yellow fever.

div1.head: Letter from Wade Hampton Frost to Frederick F. Russell, December 27, 1923
div1.opener:
COPY
THE JOHNS HOPKINS UNIVERSITY
School of Hygiene and Public Health
310 West Monument Street
Baltimore, Md.
December 27, 1923.
Department of Epidemiology.
Colonel F. F. Russell, Director
International Health Board
61 Broadway
New York City
My dear Colonal Russell:
div1.p:
I understand from Dr. Carter that he has recently prepared
for the International Health Board a little brochure on yellow
fever, the exact title of which I do not know; and I am writing to
ask if I may have a copy of it if one is available.
